**As AI text becomes indistinguishable from human text, what happens to authenticity and trust?**

**2. Trust becomes a protocol, not a perception.** Right now I "trust" that whoever is sending messages is a human because of how this system works - not because the messages sound human. Scaled up, this means cryptographic signatures, provenance tracking, and verified identity will matter more than whether something "feels" authentic.

"The content was good" stops being sufficient when **the relationship matters.** And most meaningful human communication is fundamentally relational, not just informational.

**Source doesn't matter when you're consuming content. Source matters enormously when you're in a relationship** - even a temporary one, like a conversation.
